snippet: Exactly 1,809 days after he was captured, Sgt. Bowe Bergdahl returned to a homecoming void of any relatives and dampened by a controversy over his capture and release.
abstract: Sgt Bowe Bergdahl returns to United States after five years of captivity in Afganistan by Taliban, in homecoming void of any relatives and dampened by a controversy over his capture and release; will undergo therapy and counseling at Brooke Army Medical Center in San Antonio, Tex.

byline.original: By MANNY FERNANDEZ and ERIC SCHMITT
byline.contributor: Manny Fernandez reported from San Antonio, and Eric Schmitt from Washington. David Montgomery contributed reporting from San Antonio, and Julie Hirschfeld Davis and Elisabeth Bumiller from Washington.

lead_paragraph: Exactly 1,809 days after he was captured, Sgt. Bowe Bergdahl returned to a homecoming void of any relatives and dampened by a controversy over his capture and release.

headline.main: No Ceremony for Bowe Bergdahl Upon Return to U.S. Soil
headline.print_headline: No Ceremony for Bergdahl Upon Return to U.S. Soil

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject
